item.title: Tabitha add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description:
"Are you always a smartass?'
Nope. Sometimes I'm asleep." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "You are about as covert as a sledgehammer." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description:
"I kissed her," he explained, aggrieved.
"Mmm, yes, I had the dubious pleasure of witnessing that, ah-hem, overly public occurrence." Lyall sharpened his pen nib, using a small copper blade that ejected from the end of his glassicals.
"Well! Why hasn't she done anything about it?" the Alpha wanted to know.
"You mean like whack you upside the noggin with that deadly parasol of hers? I would be cautious in that area if I were you." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "Goodness gracious me,' exclaimed Alexia, 'what <i>are</i> you wearing? It looks like the unfortunate progeny of an illicit union between a pair of binoculars and some opera glasses. What on earth are they called, binocticals, spectoculars?" -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "Please, Lord Maccon, use one of the cups. My delicate sensibilities.” The earl actually snorted. “My dear Miss Tarabotti, if you possessed any such things, you certainly have never shown them to me." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "My father,” she admitted, “was of Italian extraction. Unfortunately, not an affliction that can be cured.” She paused. “Though he did die." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "Hello, princess,” said Lord Maccon to the vampire. “Got yourself into quite a pickle this time, didn't you?” Lord Akeldama looked him up and down. “My sweet young naked boy, you are hardly one to talk. Not that I mind, of course." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "What if I arrange to be around Lord Akeldama during the full moon?” The earl looked daggers. “I am certain he would be extremely helpful in a fight. He could ruthlessly flatter all your attackers into abject submission." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Tabitha add a quote by gail carriger
item.description: "She would have colored gracefully with embarrassment had she not possessed the complexion of one of those “heathen Italians,” as her mother said, who never colored, gracefully or otherwise. (Convincing her mother that Christianity had, to all intents and purposes, originated with the Italians, thus making them the exact opposite of heathen, was a waste of time and breath.)" -- gail carriger
